name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
[Liliyuan Shangpu] An old lady in Hebei was beaten to the point of fracture just because she wanted to take a look at the National Bureau of Letters and Calls, and now she is identified as colluding with foreign forces.
A few days ago, a news report that "an old lady in Wei County, Hebei was beaten to the point of fracture in Beijing because she was mistaken for a petitioner" caused heated discussion among netizens because it was too outrageous.
However, now, the victim's family posted that a leader came to the village and said that the Weibo posted by the family was forwarded to the Internet, smearing the image of the country, saying that they colluded with foreign forces and wanted to convict the family. They also said that the current issue is no longer whether to compensate the old lady, but the issue of "colluding with foreign anti-China forces."
The old lady's son also received a call from a member of the Internet Monitoring Brigade who called himself Kong Xiangfeng, notifying the old lady's son who worked in Shenzhen to return to his hometown and said that he wanted to ask him about the situation. The family asked for written procedures and to talk on the phone, but was rejected by the other party.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: So you see, don’t stare at me and say that the news I posted affected others. If other Twitter users post news that I didn’t post, they can still be considered as “colluding with foreign forces.”

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of September 29, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications held a regular meeting of Oriental Universities. The Security Department raided the venue and explicitly prohibited those whose gender on their ID cards was male from wearing women's clothing. If the situation was serious enough to disrupt the event, the organizer would reserve the right to take further action.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 30, netizens visited the Chinese People's Liberation Army Navy Museum in Qingdao and found that the museum actually displayed towels, plates, tableware and other items used by Xi Jinping during his inspection as exhibits.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 29, Chuxiong Normal University in Yunnan held a military training end-of-training performance. The content of the exercise was that a group of college students played the role of migrant workers demanding wages and held up a sign that read "Pay back your debts" to confront another group of college students who played the role of armed police for stability maintenance. In the end, the "armed police" formation successfully escorted the "migrant workers demanding wages" out of the field.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, a principal of a school in Lianyungang, Jiangsu retired and expressed his feelings on a social platform. He thought the comment section would be full of comments thanking his teacher for his many students, but it turned out to be full of comments from students over the years complaining that they were physically punished and slapped by him.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Recently, some media reported that Telegram will establish a partnership with Tencent.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
On September 30, Guangdong Foshan No. 3 Middle School called on parents to donate to the school because it could not pay salaries.
It is said that the city education bureau currently provides limited support for public schools, and there is a serious funding gap. Teachers are in a situation where they have to rely on their love to generate electricity.
It is reported that the teachers of No. 3 Middle School have been owed wages for 9 months, but they still stick to their posts.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 30, an accident occurred at the hammer throw event of the Hangzhou Asian Games. A Qatari athlete made a mistake in throwing the ball, and it hit the referee across the net.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
September 30, Wuhan Yellow Crane Tower
Old Eighth Route Army soldiers, Vietnam War veterans complained that the neighborhood committee and village bullies occupied land and had no place to seek redress
